LanguageData.PoisonForest.label: poison forest
LanguageData.PoisonForest.description: A thick, poisonous forest. The stale air carries millions of fiberous spores. The terrain is soggy with scum and muck. Spiney thickets of poplars cover poison briar and plump fungi.
LanguageData.Savanna.label: savanna
LanguageData.Savanna.description: A savanna is a rolling grassland scattered with shrubs and isolated trees, which can be found between a tropical rainforest and desert biome. Not enough rain falls on a savanna to support forests.
LanguageData.Volcano.label: volcano
LanguageData.Volcano.description: A volcano is a rupture in the crust of a planet, that allows hot lava, volcanic ash, and gases to escape from a magma chamber below the surface.
LanguageData.Wasteland.label: wasteland
LanguageData.Wasteland.description: A highly radioactive desert. Nuclear contamination from weapons testing, war or meltdowns has permanently altered the landscape.
LanguageData.Wetland.label: wetland
LanguageData.Wetland.description: A wetland is a land area that is saturated with water, either permanently or seasonally, such that it takes on the characteristics of a distinct ecosystem.
